summary: Whispers of the White Moon is a content-driven, anime-themed single-page website built with a React + TypeScript frontend (Vite-style entry) and Tailwind CSS. The page is composed of sections (Hero, About, Characters, Worldbuilding, Episodes, Contact, Footer) whose text and structured lore are sourced from a single central configuration module (animeSiteConfig). The repository also includes an Internet Computer (ICP) Motoko backend canister scaffold (currently empty) and optional Internet Identity authentication plus a React Query-based actor creation hook to prepare for future authenticated backend calls. The previous Gallery section/navigation has been removed from the rendered layout and configuration, leaving empty placeholder files for the removed components.

architecturalNotes: React + TypeScript SPA with a single-page, section-based layout composed in App.tsx.

Content/config-driven architecture: user-facing copy and structured data (worldbuilding, characters, episodes, CTAs) centralized in frontend/src/content/animeSiteConfig.ts and consumed by section components.
Tailwind CSS theming via OKLCH CSS variables (light/dark tokens) with custom typography (Google Fonts) and additional Tailwind plugins (typography, container-queries, animate).
Navigation uses section IDs plus programmatic smooth scrolling with a fixed-header offset (implemented in TopNav and Hero CTAs).
ICP integration scaffold: InternetIdentityProvider wraps the app and manages persisted identities; useActor creates/caches an anonymous or authenticated canister actor using React Query.
Static assets (hero background, wordmark logo) are referenced via public paths under /assets/generated/.
knownIssues: backend/main.mo defines an empty actor with no methods; the frontend has ICP scaffolding but nothing to call.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts is intentionally empty; there are no typed React Query hooks for backend methods.
frontend/src/components/GallerySection.tsx and frontend/src/components/GalleryLightbox.tsx are empty placeholder files; if not referenced anywhere, they should be deleted to avoid confusion.
Duplicate global CSS files exist (frontend/src/index.css and frontend/index.css). The app imports src/index.css; the extra file can confuse maintenance and theming.
InternetIdentityProvider sets loginStatus to 'idle' in a finally block even after setting 'loginError' in the catch path, potentially masking initialization errors in UI state.
DEFAULT_IDENTITY_PROVIDER is read from process.env.II_URL; if unset, login may fail without clear guidance.
frontend/RUN-LOCAL-AND-DEPLOY-IC.md appears truncated (ends after the 'Install Dependencies' step), so run/deploy instructions are incomplete in this snapshot.
